entries.value: The type of a controlled material such as controlled nuclear item, irradiated samples, sealed radioactive source, unsealed radioactive source, nuclear material
A unique identifier of maximum length 16 characters for the controlled material

Materials are classified in terms of their potential to cause deterministic health effects. Category 1 materials are considered to be the most ‘dangerous’ because they can pose a very high risk to human health if not managed safely and securely. An exposure of only a few minutes to an unshielded Category 1 source may be fatal. At the lower end of the categorization system, sources in Category 5 are the least dangerous; however, even these sources could give rise to doses in excess of the dose limits if not properly controlled, and therefore need to be kept under appropriate regulatory control
The date when the controlled material was commissioned into service i.e. 2008-03-01

Inventory status of material. In-use designates that the material is currently used in the work of the facility. Dis-used designates that the material is no longer used in the work of the facility. Waste designates that the material is no longer used at the facility and is awaiting disposal/repatriation. Disposal designates that the material has been disposed of. When the material is disposed or repatriated the record will contain the relevant authorisations and details to allow for traceability
The location where the controlled material is stored
